title: Jan Shikshan Sansthan Jorhat
detailsOfAchievement: The scheme of Jan Shikshan Sansthan (JSS) is a unique scheme crafted by the Government of India.JSSs are institutes of Peopleâ€™s Education focusing on the poor, the illiterates, the neo-literates, the under-privileged and the un-reached.The Jan Shikshan Sansthans are unique in that they do not provide just skill development, but link literacy with vocational skills and provide large doses of Life Enrichment Education (LEE) to the people.They do not work in isolation but aim for convergence with other stakeholders in society.It is their endeavour to shape their beneficiaries into self reliant and self-assured employees and entrepreneurs. The Jan Shikshan Sansthans are unique also because they offer quality vocational skills and technical knowledge at a very low cost.Their doors are open to everyone and they reach out to their clientele groups by setting up sub centres in the heart of the slum or in remote rural areas.They are different from other vocational training institutions as they offer quality vocational skills and technical knowledge at such a low cost; provide need based and literacy-linked vocational training in most courses without insisting on age limit or prior educational qualifications; reach out to the clientele in their areas unlike other institutions which the clientele has to access whether near or far; offer a multi-faceted skill-knowledge-awareness enhancement and outlook formation trainings and inputs and empowerment-oriented interventions in respect of social, economic and health status improvement of women and adolescent girls. The scheme of Jan Shikshan Santhan (JSS) was initially launched in 1967 as Shramik Vidyapeeth, a polyvalent or multi-faceted adult education institution, aimed at improving the vocational skills and quality of life of the industrial workers and their family members as well as those persons who had been migrating from rural to urban settings. The scheme of Shramik Vidyapeeth was renamed as Jan Shikshan Sansthan in April 2000.Along with the change in its name came the change in its focus. A scheme that was meant for the industrial workers and their families was expanded both in terms of its clientele and focus and was extended to the rural areas.There was logic for its expansion.Total Literacy Campaigns, launched after the setting up of the National Literacy Mission in 1988, had transformed the literacy landscape of the country and created an army of neo-literates who having realized the power of the written word, now wanted to use it to improve their livelihoods through skill development.The post-literacy programme had given a few of them the taste of vocational skills but the continuing education programme promised to extend it to many more beneficiaries.That became the rationale of setting up more Jan Shikshan Sansthans, to match the needs of the districts. Today, there 221 Jan Shikshan Sansthans in the country and they are expected to act as district level resource support agencies especially in regard to organization of vocational training and skill development programmes for the neo-literates and other target groups of the continuing education programme.The current aim is that the JSSs should progressively move towards having 50% of their beneficiaries from amongst the neo-literates.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Our organization have been working on Low Cost Sanitation Programme in various Development Blocks in Golaghat district. We organised awareness camps at various places for popularization of Open Defecation Free Society and how to get pollution free environment in our society.

We worked on Sanitation programmes and other awareness camps at various parts of Golaghat district . We educated people not to defecate in the open , improved water facilities, sanitation and hygiene practices. We particularly focused on Schools and formation of School Sanitation Clubs. We also persuaded people to plant at least five trees per family and also to plant trees around public toilets for environmental protection.

We worked for the development of our society by organizing various awareness programmes along with Sanitation. We organized the following programmes : (i) Environment related programmes. (ii) Women Empowerment and SHG Training programme. (iii) AIDS Awareness Programme. (iv) Observed various days of importance such as Environment Day , National Science Day , National Energy Day etc. (v) Disaster Management Camp. (vi) Mason Training Programme.

detailsOfAchievement: The Janakalyan Sangstha Assam has been doing various work since 2002 to till date, like Agriculture, Education, Health, A.H. & Veterinary, Irrigation, Human Rights, Cultural and Socio-Economic income generating programme for the rural and urban people. The society is working for health service, physically handicapped, widow, poverty eradication and literacy campaign for global worming and all environmental activities, ecology protection and guidance, promote technical and scientific knowledge. The organisation has setup weaving, kniding, embroidery and other technical training institution to train the rural youths for income generation of employment opportunities. The organization has maintain a common instructional agricultural firm, poultry firm, dairy firm, fishery and all sorts of small and large size of live stock for helping the rural people. It has also organize various training programme treatment and vaccination camps for animal to render free service to poor live stock farmers. The organization has serve to create awareness among the people about already diseas like AIDS through various kinds of publication, awareness camp, procession etc. and will take necessary measures to prevent such disease. The Janakalyan Sangstha Assam is a all rounder organization. It has implemented many Project in educational and training sector. The Sangstha has running DKBRP Girls High School, Dhupaguri Primary English School, Dhupaguri Jim Academy Primary School. In training sector, the organization has running support to training and employment programme (STEP) for women through diary. It has also arranged and held many temporary training programme on Agriculture, A.H. & Veterinary, Fishery, Dairy and Poultry and on many other income generating sector.The organization has also worked for the persion with disabilities. It has arranged and held health camp for disable person and provides Medicine, Tri-Cycle, Wheel Chair, hearing aids to disable person time to time. The organization has render all sorts of welfare services to the all communities irrespective of caste, creed and community.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The Janakalyan Sangshtha Assam has implemented the Project namely-support to training and Employment Programe(STEP) for woman through dairy, at Dhupaguri Nagaon(assam). It has impact to increase self relience and autonomy of women by enhanching their productivity and enabaling them to take income generation activities. It provides training for skill upgradation of poor and assetless women in traditional sector-Dairy to ensure regular income, imployment,welfare and various support services.

detailsOfAchievement: The Jumma Minority Welfare Society (Regd.) is a charitable trust of India based on socio-economic concept with an intention to alleviate the living condition of the Jummas (All minorities based on population, religion, customs and usually practice Jhum cultivation or shifting cultivation in the state) and was established in 9th May 2013. isuues.value: Biotechnology,Health & Family Welfare,Scientific & Industrial Research,Science & Technology

detailsOfAchievement: We are NGO with many welfare and medical camps conducted every year in Assam. We are running a biotechnology and cell culture lab at Guwhaati IIT Biotech park since 2012. We have collaborated with Stanford university in the past and have ongoing collaboration with Jawaharlal Nehru university in India. Scientifically we have a good team of students, doctors, Scientist and volunteers who actively participate in ongoing research work. The leading work of the Ngo is in identifying the stem cells that hide M.tuberculosis and can act as a relapse source for the disease. Our team has published three scientific papers mentioned below. 1) Preclinical and Clinical Evidence of Mycobacterium tuberculosis Persistence in the Hypoxic Niche of Bone Marrow Mesenchymal Stem Cells after Therapy. Garhyan J, Bhuyan S, Pulu I, Kalita D, Das B, Bhatnagar R. Am J Pathol. 2015 Jul;185(7):1924-34. PMID:26066709 2) Bone marrow mesenchymal stem cells provide an antibiotic-protective niche for persistent viable Mycobacterium tuberculosis that survive antibiotic treatment. Beamer G, Major S, Das B, Campos-Neto A. Am J Pathol. 2014 Dec;184(12):3170-5. PMID:25451154 3) CD271(+) bone marrow mesenchymal stem cells may provide a niche for dormant Mycobacterium tuberculosis. Das B, Kashino SS, Pulu I, Kalita D, Swami V, Yeger H, Felsher DW, Campos-Neto A. Sci Transl Med. 2013 Jan 30;5(170):170ra13. PMID:23363977

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Role of MSC in MDR-TB compensatory mutation

detailsOfAchievement: The activities Performed by Keshab Smarak Sanskriti Surabhi are as follows : The Samiti is Conducting regular Allopathic Medical Camps in different places of Barak Valley. Free medicines are also proving to the patients. A Mobile Medical Van is launched by the Samiti to bring doctors at the remote corner of the region and to cater the needs of the poor people for getting better health services. This Samiti celebrated Vishwa Yoga Divas with full zeal & enthusiasm. The two day Yoga Divas was inaugurated in G.C. College Auditorium, Silchar by the Honorable Governor of Assam, Shri P.B. Acharya on 20th June 2015. To eradicate Diabetes, a Programme was taken for 7 days in Silchar. Sri Sumanta Chandwarkar, a famous Yoga Teacher from Maharastra taught the technique of Yoga to the participants in the camp which started on 22nd June, 2015. About 200 members were present in the function & 61 No. of Patients attended the Camp To Provide medical assistance to the residents of remote areas, Keshab Smarak Sanskriti Surabhi had Launched Dhanwantari Seva Yatra Progamme in Barak Valley in the month of May 2015 & February 2016 respectively. A Joint programme of Seva Bharati Purbanchal & National Medical Organization, A total of 15 doctors of NMO came from across India to provide Medical Treatment to the Patients of Rural Area in Barak Valley & Mizoram. The No. of Camps were about 20 & Patients were about 4000. Besides giving Treatment, Medicines were distributed amongst the patients free of cost. 3 numbers of Computer Training centre are running by the samity at 3 differnt places. On 20th June 2015, the Honorable Governor of Assam Inaugurated Gramin Computer Training Centre under patronage of Surabhi. Training Centre for Sewing machine for ladies are running at 4 centres in Assam and Mizoram. House building materials and blankets as well as mosquito nets were provided to the victims of different natural calamities Surabhi Databbya Homoeo Treatment Centre is giving its service in Kalibari Char area of Silchar. Every Friday, Dr. Subhadip Kar renders free Service to the residents of that area through checkup & distributing Medicines free of cost. This Yojna is presently running in Assam, Tripura and Mizoram states in 754 centres running by 1384 Arogya Mitras. They are acting as rural health worker aiming to serve rural population. Surabhi Tabla School in running in Surabhi Karalaya under the Patronage of Surabhi Kalakendra. Every Sunday Sri Subhrajit Kar (Executive Member, K.S.S.S) imparts training to students free of cost. A Surabhi Yoga Center is successfully going on in Narshingpur at Cachar. Besides Yoga camps are organised at different locations of Assam and Tripura. On 21st Feb, 2016 a programme on Corneal Blindness Free India & Eye Donation was jointly organized by us & Barak Netradaan Sankalp Abhiyan Samiti under the initiative of SAKSHAM.

detailsOfAchievement: PLANTATION DRIVES

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Celebration of National Youth Day 2017 NYK, Haflong in collaboration with KOSHISH SOCIETY HAFLONG celebrated National Youth Day on 12-01-2017 at Shri Shri Jagannath Bari , Haflong from 5.30 pm onwards. KOSHISH SOCIETY also took part in the Rally event and Blood Donation Camp organised by Ram Krishna Mission Haflong on 12-01-2017 from 7.30 am to 12.30 pm.

Working towards this noble cause, NYK in collaboration with Koshish Society organised a Plantation Drive on 05-06- 2017, to sensitise students on the value of tree plantation. The saplings were procured from the Department of Forest, Haflong. We planted around 250 saplings in the school campus namely Govt Girls HS School, C.H.T Synod HS School, Lower Haflong High School, Saraswati Vidya Mandir with the support of the school authority and students.

detailsOfAchievement: Promoted one thousand Women Self Help Groups Promoted fifteen Nos of Farmers Club Promoted one hundred Joint Liability Groups Promoted Two numbers of Producer Groups Imparted training to one thousand women Self on livelihood sectors About five hundred Hectare of land has been brought under sustainable agricultural practices four hundred numbers of organic farmers created use of chemical pesticide and fertilizer reduced by fity to sixty percent

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Increasing productivity of paddy with sustainable agricultural practices . Five villages under Nalbari district was covered. The Project was started since 2011 and completed in the year 2015. Total about 1200 numbers of farmers with about 400 hectare of land.

Promotion of native variety of paddy with sustainable agricultural practices with special emphasis on increasing the income of the growers families. Fourty five villages under Nalbari disitrict was covered. Thirty seven numbers of native paddy identified in project vilalges. Documentation was done for 15 variety which are of important in view of seed sovereignty and climate change. Application submitted for GI registration of one native vaiety.Low cost seed bank have been established .

Training and demonstration was carried out for 200 numbers of farmers for adoption of SRI method in 200 Bigha of land. Improved variety of paddy introduced in the project location. Both inhouse and field training was given to the participating farmers. Close monitoring was done with the technical staff of the Lotus Progressive Centre. The productivity increased by 30-40 %.

Fourty five farmers were covered under the proeject. About 15 hectare of land was undertaken for cultivation of TS-36/38 variety of mustard . Standard package of practices developed by Assam Agricultural University was adopted by the participating farmers . Production increased 30-40%.

The objective of the project is to reduce the use of external inputs like chemical fertilizers and pesticides , hybrid. Use of native as well as high yielding crops with eco-friendly practices was adopted among the participating farmers.
Training was given to women SHG members on improved weaving technology , scientific rearing of livestock and poultry , group dynamics, record keeping
The purpose of the project is to organize sell cum exhibition outlet in local festival for direct interaction of producers and customers.
To popularize the SRI model among the farmers for increasing the productivity of paddy.
The purpose is to reduce external agricultural inputs and to promote eco-agriculture practices .
To digitize the information of SHGs and upload the information in Eshakti plateform launched by NABARD.
To promote farmers producer organization for collective production , processing ,grading and marketing of products for better income .
Collection and Analysis of sample for preparing Soil Health Card of farmers.
To facilitate women farmers through training ,demonstration and exposure for adopting sustainable agricultural practices.

detailsOfAchievement: Macbeth Drama took it inception in the year 1994 in consequence of an untiring endeavour of a few play lovers of Dhemaji both veteran and novice, having considerable experience in the concerned field of study and operation. It aims at enriching the Assamese culture through proper presentation, research and expansion of various ethnic group of Assam and has worked to his end since the very beginning. In particular it has continued its effort to bring modern drama to the common people by way of dramatic presentation of tribal folk traditions of a few linguistic communities such as the Misings, the Kacharies, the Deories as well as the Lalungs which are aboriginal sub-tribes of Assam. It has been holding Karmashalas and training programs and has tried to draw out pure connoisseurs of the respective area of learning. Till date Macbeth Drama has made the stage performance of more than sixty (60) dramas. Moreover it has made dramatic versions of one novel, three short stories and four folk tales and has staged them well. It has also made the necessary arrangements of for imparting short term training to twenty five trainees at National School of Drama, New Delhi and organized 45 days intensive theater workshop in auspice of National School of Drama, New Delhi an in collaboration with Jirsong Theater, Assam. A few of the notable plays that Macbeth Drama has staged successfully are â€˜Swapna Amaar Surujmukhi Phoolâ€™, â€˜Chandita Gaadyat Epiyala Madya Athabaa Ati Padya Athaba Nabyadyaâ€™, â€˜Nyay-Nishthaaâ€™ (Assamese version of â€˜Les Justesâ€™ of Albert Camus), â€˜Mrs. Adisâ€™, â€˜Jarou Rua Parjaâ€™, â€˜Saat Saaudar Chenehi Bhaniâ€™, â€˜Tejimalaâ€™, â€˜Miri Jiyariâ€™, â€˜Labhitaâ€™, â€˜Gaonloi Jaonâ€™, â€˜Kaanchamotir Bihad Gathaâ€™ and â€˜Bhaal Paau Aakaahar Meghar Dhemaliâ€™, â€˜Chandra Kantaâ€™, â€˜Joymotiâ€™. Moreover the group independently organized a theater festival in 2011.

detailsOfAchievement: Manab Sewa and Vikash Samittee was established in the year 1989. It has been registered under Societies Registration Act XXI of 1860 in the year 1993. Its aim is to create a society just by enabling the disadvantage group, to germinate love, fertility and fellow feeling among all the religion to work for the all round development of the society. The main motto of our organisation is Health Education Socio economic and Cultural Development of the Society. The organization has been working in different socio-economic development sectors in poor and backward areas of Assam. The organisation put more emphasis on three developmental sectors namely Education Health and Income Generation. It has been engaged in different awareness and motivational camps/campaigns in both rural and urban areas and organizing people for having benefits provided from different Govt NonGovt agencies. The organization believes that peace and prosperity can be established only through better organization of people in constructive line. Education Our organization have been running special schools for child labour under Ministry of Child Labour as well as running educational programme under SSA kamrup District. Several other vocational training like Cutting Knitting and Toy making and Toy making so that the beneficiaries can take up the trade to earn their livelihood. Lots of other Awareness Programmes like Mother Child health Awareness Women Right Awareness HIV Awareness have been conducted for making aware of the people of this region. As the inhabitants of these concerned areas are mostly backward. Sports we have been conducting several sports competitions to develop in this field for the young people of this region

sourceOfFunds.purpose: As we tried to use this programme as a tool for establishing peace and harmony among different social sections of the locality for creating a favourable environment-? To provide positive stimulation and congenial environment for their all-round development etc.
